pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:5.1: 44. The training rule on providing services for lay people
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:6.2: At that time the nuns were providing services for lay people.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:6.3: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:6.4: “How can nuns provide services for lay people?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:6.5: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:6.8: How can nuns provide services for lay people?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:6.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:6.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:7.1: ‘If a nun provides services for a lay person, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:8.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:9.2: if she cooks rice-porridge, a meal, or non-staple food for a lay person, or she washes clothes or a turban for them, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:10.2: if it is a rice-porridge drink;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:10.3: if it is a meal for the Order;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:10.4: if it is to venerate a stupa;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:10.5: if she cooks rice-porridge, a meal, or non-staple food for her own service-provider, or she washes clothes or a turban for them;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:10.7: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:11.1: The fourth training rule is finished.
